abstract.para: This article describes how to deploy &productnameshort; on an &zseries; host using the &agama; installer.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: Before installing &productnameshort; on &zseries;, you need to fulfill the following requirements:

section.title: Example deployment procedure
section.para: The following procedure describes steps to deploy &productnameshort; on an &zseries; machine via a z/VM console.

step.para: Install the x3270 package that provides the 3270-type terminal emulator.
Connect to the LPAR server using the x3270 console. When asked, provide your login credentials.

step.para: Link the TCPMAINT disk to have the FTP command available:
Connect to the FTP server and download the required files for IPLing installation. In our case, the anonymous user is allowed:
step.screen:
FTP example.org (addr ipv4 anonymous
cd boot/s390x locsite fix 80 ascii get parmfile sles.parmfile.a (repl get sles.exec sles.exec.a (repl locsite fix 80 binary get linux sles.linux.a (repl get initrd sles.initrd.a (repl quit

note.para: The locsite fix 80 command sets the VM file format to a fixed length of 80. This file format is necessary for punching the binary files to a virtual machine reader.

step.para: Optionally, you can use the FILELIST command to list the files and edit the parmfile with XEDIT. Our example parmfile has the following content:

callout.para: Although the cio_ignore parameter is optional, it is used to list only the relevant installation devices and accept the devices that are used for the installation.

Because we do not have an interactive dialog for enabling and configuring our network device, we need to provide the settings through the kernel command line. The rd.zdev option activates the qeth device and the ip option configures network settings for the enc800 Linux network interface.
The system boots from a live image retrieved from the specified URL. Our example uses FTP protocol, but it can be HTTP as well.

step.para: The following is the content of the sles.exec file:
step.screen: /* REXX LOAD EXEC FOR SUSE LINUX S/390 VM GUESTS */ /* LOADS SUSE LINUX S/390 FILES INTO READER */ SAY '' SAY 'LOADING SLES FILES INTO READER...' 'CP CLOSE RDR' 'PURGE RDR ALL' 'SPOOL PUNCH * RDR' 'PUNCH SLES LINUX A (NOH' 'PUNCH SLES PARMFILE A (NOH' 'PUNCH SLES INITRD A (NOH' 'IPL 00C'
